nodes.bodyText: I'm not familiar with V but I'm assuming this means it's inlined by the compiler? If so, that will have to be removed for the json serialization route.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,37 @@
+import json
+import syou.picoev
+import syou.picohttpparser as hp
+
+struct Message {
+	message string
+}
+
+[inline]

nodes.bodyText: it is static inline equivalent of C, it does inline function but not JSON encoding part.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,37 @@
+import json
+import syou.picoev
+import syou.picohttpparser as hp
+
+struct Message {
+	message string
+}
+
+[inline]

nodes.bodyText: can you add -yqq to update and install to quiet them a bit
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,13 @@
+FROM debian:sid
+
+WORKDIR /app
+
+RUN apt-get update && apt-get install wget unzip build-essential ca-certificates --no-install-recommends --yes

nodes.bodyText: a -q here as well for the noise
nodes.diffHunk:

nodes.bodyText:
I wonder if that's the reason why pico.v tops the benchmark.
https://github.com/TechEmpower/FrameworkBenchmarks/wiki/Project-Information-Framework-Tests-Overview#json-serialization

The recommended URI is /json.

Not a must, but other implementations use /json URL.
